intro: Hendecandra texensis, commonly known as Texas holly, is a deciduous shrub native to the south-central United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its flowers are white and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, dark blue berries. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
